187 Pesilat Sitembak Perebutkan Piala Bergilir Bupati Buleleng


KBRN, Singaraja : Sedikitnya 187 Pesilat dari perguruan pencak silat Sitembak terlibat dalam Kejuaraan Pencak Silat Sitembak Cup XI, memperebutkan piala bergilir Bupati Buleleng VIII.
Kejuaraan diikuti 49 sekolah se-Kabupaten Buleleng, dibuka Asisten Administrasi Umum Setda Buleleng, Gede Suyasa, Kamis (7/11/2019) di Balai Desa Banjarasem, Kecamatan Seririt.
Gede Suyasa mengatakan, kejuaraan ini merupakan salah satu inovasi dan kreatifitas dari sebuah perguruan agar nantinya dapat menelorkan atlet-atlet muda yang membawa nama perguruan ke jenjang lebih tinggi.
“Salah satu dari bentuk inovasi kreativitas ya, masing-masing perguruan yang membikin kejuaraan dan yang diajak kan satu peguruan. Nah kalau nanti melebar keluar, saya fikir kembali ke induk organisasi yaitu IPSI,” ucapnya.
Lebih jauh dikatakan Suyasa, selain memperebutkan piala bergilir Bupati Buleleng, kegiatan tersebut juga merupakan salah satu tolok ukur terhadap para pesilat serta sebagai latihan mental dan penguasaan teknik bertanding dalam menghadapi kejuaraan-kejuaraan dijenjang yang lebih tinggi.
Ketua Panitia pelaksana, Made Putra Arsana mengatakan, kejuaraan berlangsung lima hari, mulai 6 hingga 10 Nopember 2019, diikuti 187 pesilat sitembak tingkat SD, SMP hingga SMA/SMK, dari perguruan sitembak yang ada di Kabupaten Buleleng.
“Ini adalah penjaringan bibit atlet untuk tingkat remaja, yang nanti tanggal 20 ini kami kirim dalam kejuaraan open cup Buleleng,” jelasnya.
Made Putra menambahkan, pada kejuaraan tahun ini ada peningkatan peserta sebanyak 25 persen dari tahun sebelumnya. Peningkatan tersebut terlihat dari jumlah sekolah yang mengikuti kejuaraan, yaitu tahun lalu sebanyak 27 sekolah dan tahun ini menjadi 49 sekolah. Menurut Made Putra, ini merupakan prestasi menggembirakan bagi Perguruan Sitembak yang ada di Kabupaten Buleleng.

KBRN, Singaraja: At least 187 pesilat from the Sitembak silat college were involved in the Pencak Silat Cup XI Championship, fighting for the rotating trophy of the Regent of Buleleng VIII.
The championship was attended by 49 schools throughout the Regency of Buleleng, opened by the General Administration Assistant of the Regional Secretary of Buleleng, Gede Suyasa, Thursday (11/07/2019) at the Banjarasem Village Hall, Seririt District.
Gede Suyasa said, this championship was one of the innovations and creativity of a college so that later it could bring forth young athletes who brought the name of the college to a higher level.
"One of the forms of creativity innovation, yes, each college makes a championship and is invited to a teacher. "If later it widens out, I think of going back to the parent organization that is IPSI," he said.
Furthermore, Suyasa said, besides fighting over the rotating trophy of the Regent of Buleleng, the activity was also one of the benchmarks against the fighters as well as mental training and mastery of competing techniques in dealing with championships at a higher level.
The Head of the Organizing Committee, Made Putra Arsana, said that the championship lasted for five days, starting from 6 to 10 November 2019, followed by 187 elementary, junior high to high school / vocational high school citricate fighters, from the local shooting schools in Buleleng Regency.
"This is a selection of seeds for youth athletes, which later on the 20th we send in the Buleleng open cup championship," he explained.
Made Putra added, in this year's championship there was an increase of participants as much as 25 percent from the previous year. The increase was seen from the number of schools participating in the championship, which was 27 schools last year and this year to 49 schools. According to Made Putra, this is an encouraging achievement for the Sitembak College in Buleleng Regency.
